subject: Port missing xensm classes from Nova.
messages:
[{'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-09-12 02:09:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm open to feedback on how to best maintain and sync these Xen classes w/ Nova over the long term. As part of this port I significantly reduced the size of these classes so Cinder only contains what it needs. I think I got it mostly right... not a lot (any!) tests on most of these classes in Nova so we'll have to rely on functional testing on these for now.

If we were to copy the existing classes over from Nova as-is (with minimal changes) this patchset would be over twice as big."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-09-12 02:20:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-12 02:36:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/12843/2/check/gate-cinder-merge/853 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12843/2/check/gate-cinder-docs/767 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12843/2/check/gate-cinder-pep8/806 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12843/2/check/gate-cinder-python26/795 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12843/2/check/gate-cinder-python27/807 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12843/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/11262 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12843/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-cinder/1243 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2012-09-12 03:35:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'd like to make sure Renuka takes a look at this, added her to the reviewers list."}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-09-12 10:36:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Renuka is away this week, but I can take a look.

We should check with her, but I think there were plans to re-write the XenSM code, so it might be best to remove the driver from Cinder, so we can add the newer implementation in Grizzly?

XenSM assumes XenServer SRs can safely be attached to two different XenServer hosts (that are not pooled), and that is (currently) not the case."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-09-12 15:37:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

John: Just so I'm clear... when you say its currently not the case that XenServer can safely attached to two or more hosts to the same SR... are you referring to Nova as well? If this is unsafe shouldn't we also consider removing this driver in Nova Folsom as well?

Or did I perhaps miss something when I ported the required classes over?

To me if this driver isn't suitable for Cinder then it seems like it should also be removed from Nova as well."}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-09-12 17:55:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Good point. I think the answer is no for nova, yes for cinder. Here was my thinking:

It should work with with certain configurations(afraid I don't remember what they are).

However, I would like to see a more robust approach in the future, that would feel quite different: one SR per VDI, and the ability to migrate them between hosts.

So, my thinking is it should really be marked as "proof of concept" in nova or "deprecated". Mostly to state there will be no migration path to lunar (mostly because moving to one SR per VDI, or something like that, would be near impossible to migrate)

I hope that makes sense?'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-09-18 15:30:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think Renuka is back Wednesday, so we can clear this up with her.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-11-08 19:16:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

John,

Any updates on this. This branch was my take on making XenSM work in Cinder for Folsom.

As you suggested are there plans for a new implementation?

As is in the Folsom/Grizzly code the XenSM driver attempts to import modules which just don't exist... as such if we aren't going to fix them then removal from the codebase is probably the next best option. I personally hate to see us cut releases drivers that just plain don't work."}]

commit_message:
Port missing xensm classes from Nova.

Ports some missing nova/virt classes that are required to make
the xensm volume driver work correctly. This includes the XenAPISession
class, and parts of the volume_utils, vm_utils, and volumeops
modules as well.

Fixes LP Bug #1049424.

Change-Id: I94e2e493aa63426a6817d4a753627520205d40b1

'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2012-11-08 14:25:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-11-08 14:44:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Its not clear to me why the order of the backend store and registry deletion is no longer required from patch set 6 onwards.

Is the non-ownership issue (now explicitly checked for in advance) the *only* case in which the registry metedata deletion can fail?

For consistency with stable/folsom and master (and to prevent any future confusion), would it make sense to also also attempt the metadata deletion in advance of deleting the backend store content?

Or is preserving the old order somehow required for stable/essex to gate?

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-11-08 16:02:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

The schedule_delete_from_backend method does one of two things:

1) if delayed_delete is on, it will blindly schedule an image for deletion then attempt to update the database with a pending_delete status

2) if delayed_delete is off, it will update the database with a deleted status then carry through with the actual deletion of the image from the backend store

Once the schedule_delete_from_backend method is called, we call out to the registry once again to actually delete the image record (setting deleted=1).

The flaw here is in the first case - a user can schedule a delete without any mutation authorization in the case that delayed_delete is enabled.

The problem with inverting the registry and schedule_delete_from_backend calls prevents schedule_delete_from_backend from being able to update the image status. The image record is essentially gone from the db (deleted=1) and schedule_delete_from_backend can't actually fetch it to apply a change."}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-11-08 16:09:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Approved

Got it, thanks for the clarification.

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-08 16:09:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: No score

Starting gate jobs.

commit_message:
fixes bug 1074172

updated diablo token based on output from diablo/stable keystone
added expiry to example tokens for test_auth_middleware
added a stack based HTTP response to test_auth_middleware to verify
sequencing

commit_message:
Add retries to cinderclient.

HTTPClient now supports a retries argument. It will reissue requests
for any 5xx or socket (400 with n/a) errors. This retry loop was
"inspired" by swiftclient's loop. It reauths one extra time if
necessary.  It uses backoff times of 1, 2, 4... seconds.

The default is 0 retries. It is also exposed to the shell as well with
a --retries arg.

Change-Id: I67bed02d65155f4a4d5d879bb233f56cc78849fa

commit_message:
Make HostManager.get_all_host_states() return an iterator

Change the method's returning from a dictionary {host: HostState}
to an iterator for HostState, because the only caller of the method
(in filter_scheduler.py) is not interested in its key.

Change-Id: I84f649795a422e392a4c0d555c6cb29a01fae2d9

Bug desc: build_usb_boot.sh is unable to find build_uec_ramdisk.sh while being called from tools directory. Variable with correct path wasn't been used at all.

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-07 21:44:19.000000000', 'message': "Use computed size on object PUT, not fstat.

The object server knows the size of the file on disk already since
it's counted the bytes as they were written out. There's no need to go
ask the filesystem.

This also lets object PUTs work when the filesystem is some crazy,
non-POSIX thing that doesn't always give the right answers from
fstat(). See bug 904723 for a case when this happened.

Fixes bug 904723.

Change-Id: Ibdf44ea991e0cc4f9e0997cc9ff566cb0eac5332
"}]
commit_message:
Use computed size on object PUT, not fstat.

The object server knows the size of the file on disk already since
it's counted the bytes as they were written out. There's no need to go
ask the filesystem.

This also lets object PUTs work when the filesystem is some crazy,
non-POSIX thing that doesn't always give the right answers from
fstat(). See bug 904723 for a case when this happened.

Fixes bug 904723.

Change-Id: Ibdf44ea991e0cc4f9e0997cc9ff566cb0eac5332

[{'created': '2012-11-07 21:49:47.000000000', 'message': 'Fixed bug with internal client listings

Change-Id: I29fdd351fd60c8e63874b44d604c5fdff35169d4
'}, {'created': '2012-11-07 23:23:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fixed bug with internal client listings

There was a bug with the internal client doing listings that happened
to run across a Unicode object name for use as a marker.

Change-Id: I29fdd351fd60c8e63874b44d604c5fdff35169d4
'}, {'created': '2012-11-08 00:07:35.000000000', 'message': "Fixed bugs with internal client and object expirer

These bug fixes are lumped together because they all caused problems
with the object expirer doing its job.

There was a bug with the internal client doing listings that happened
to run across a Unicode object name for use as a marker.

There was a bug with the object expirer not utf8 encoding object
names it got from json listings, causing deletes to fail.

There was a bug with the object expirer url quoting object names when
calling the internal client's make_request, when make_request already
handles that.

Change-Id: I29fdd351fd60c8e63874b44d604c5fdff35169d4
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed bugs with internal client and object expirer

These bug fixes are lumped together because they all caused problems
with the object expirer doing its job.

There was a bug with the internal client doing listings that happened
to run across a Unicode object name for use as a marker.

There was a bug with the object expirer not utf8 encoding object
names it got from json listings, causing deletes to fail.

There was a bug with the object expirer url quoting object names when
calling the internal client's make_request, when make_request already
handles that.

Change-Id: I29fdd351fd60c8e63874b44d604c5fdff35169d4

commit_message:
Mediate between nova and common RequestContext

Mediate between ceilo.openstack.common.context.RequestContext.show_deleted
attribute and nova.context.RequestContext.read_deleted.

Quick fix for:

  AttributeError: 'RequestContext' object has no attribute 'read_deleted'

in the nova DB API calls.

Change-Id: Ib3d3d6545d79414c20e8a2e4ccf9e27c50541fe2

commit_message:
Include 'extra' attributes twice (bug 1076120)

In order to maintain backwards-compatibility with the output of the
previously-broken SQL driver, non-indexed attributes are included in the
update user/tenant response in both the correct and expected locations.

Change-Id: I54f69c0c4cb3ade349190bc0c61539dcc1846267

commit_message:
Send instance_type to resize_instance.

Send the instance_type as an argument to the resize_instance method in
the compute rpc api.  Previously, the code would look up the new
instance_type's ID that is saved in the migration, and then look up the
instance_type in the db using the ID.  This removes another db read from
the nova-compute service.

Part of blueprint no-db-compute.

Change-Id: Ica45cb94191e9418446056e4fb59d3b9337a41ec

commit_message:
Remove instance_type db lookup in prep_resize.

Remove a db read in prep_resize() by grabbing the instance_type data out
of the instance dict.  The code was unnecessarily looking it up from the
db.

Part of blueprint no-db-compute.

Change-Id: I6e26a8a90f7cfca12426fad2430a0eb73991f42f

commit_message:
Send all aggregate data to remove_aggregate_host.

Update the remove_aggregate_host method of the compute rpc api to take
in all of the aggregate data instead of looking it up from the db in the
compute manager.  This removes a db read from the nova-compute service.

Part of blueprint no-db-compute.

Change-Id: I8da3da264e358c14df97ba34d250e46c6cb577e2

commit_message:
Few changes to get_uec_image.sh:

Fixed typo in usage message

Fixed usage message to represent actual code

Set default minimum image size to 2000MB from 2000*BS

fixed bug not creating directory for downoladed files

Change-Id: Id736ac7984f88e61b685569b6ba5e9158bea5889

added percise and quantal

Change-Id: Id9cb74dded044ec998700c1b456a8077f76c96e8

Don't we need to add a package related to arping to files/rpms/quantum?"}, {'account_id': 1935, 'date': '2012-11-08 03:30:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Good question. But I really don't know:)"}, {'account_id': 1935, 'date': '2012-11-08 05:03:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I quickly took a look at rpms/quantum and learned that it is quite different from apts, which is quite reasonable; packaging is different, probably default installers are different.  (I hit this issue with Quantal server, BTW).

So, my vote is that just keep this patch for apt only, modifying the commit log to say so because i'm not sure if this issue happens on rpm based platforms and I don't even know which package arping belongs to.

What do you think?"}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-11-08 05:07:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

arping is in the iputils package in Fedora which is already in files/rpms/quantum.  I would have asked Tomoe to add it otherwise. commit_message:
Add iputils-arping package for quantum l3 agent.

This is for Ubuntu only since arping command is
packeged in iputils on Fedora, which is already
in files/rpms/quantum.

Change-Id: I8318929fb35a12e0fb7a6a148d8ef0554cf3bc30
Signed-off-by: Tomoe Sugihara <tomoe@midokura.com>

commit_message:
Add support for using postgresql.

This adds a new condition to enable postgresql in devstack.
This will allow for periodic testing of tempest with either
mysql or postgresql.

Change-Id: I1849d1cd0d03d9911e6cd9973a9d9f960f30e91a

commit_message:
Add admin only action for force detach

This action calls the same methods nova would after it successfully
detaches a volume.  By exposing it to the administrator it makes it's
easier to repair un-syncronized state between services.  Generally when
the host is no longer attached, but the volume state is wrong.

Future work: The Iscsi based drivers don't seem to use
initialize_connection and terminate_connection to create the export for
the volume.  This would be more useful with drivers that do that.

I added the force parameter to terminate_connection for drivers that may
want to differintiate between a normal terminate and the force detach.

Future Nova work:  Nova will want an admin action to update the bdm
tables - today it's a bit of nova-manage shell work.

Change-Id: Icc1cff0f50a5ace9ebdae62c85524ee8d6ec23e0

commit_message:
Fix QPID reconnect issues

This fixes bug 1073999.

The problem results from the eventlet monkey patching and the way in
which qpid performs the session reconnection. The solution is to have
the qpid reconnection disbaled and the common rpc code performing the
reconnection.

The time waiting between reconnections will be a multiple
of 2 starting at 1 and a maximum of 60 seconds.

Change-Id: I25067623481fcf29a6f949c3b884ea5830724d10

commit_message:
Switch from FLAGS to CONF in nova.virt

Use the global CONF variable instead of FLAGS. This is purely a cleanup
since FLAGS is already just another reference to CONF.

We leave the nova.flags imports until a later cleanup commit since
removing them may cause unpredictable problems due to config options not
being registered.

Change-Id: Icb61d67965628dca65bda393d4373beab5c5c64a

commit_message:
Switch from FLAGS to CONF in nova.console

Use the global CONF variable instead of FLAGS. This is purely a cleanup
since FLAGS is already just another reference to CONF.

We leave the nova.flags imports until a later cleanup commit since
removing them may cause unpredictable problems due to config options not
being registered.

Change-Id: I155d363e26260aa402bb918b4d0726502e7e8758

commit_message:
Fixes the flavor edit where stale data is shown.

The commit fixes an issue where the stale flavor information from a
deleted flavor instance was being used to populate the Edit form.
The fix also takes care of an issue related to calculating the next
flavor id when creating a new flavor. Also modified the test case to
test for a new flavor id being created for all edits

Fixes bug 1057799

Change-Id: Ib8013dc4ff76b2a5736df4c2344bc0da08b2e3af

commit_message:
Make ComputeDrivers send hypervisor_hostname

hypervisor_hostname is set in get_available_resource() and
in get_host_stats(). Except for vmwareapi driver.

Change-Id: I66348ae1e986162b8139b04ab03c42c424338175

commit_message:
Corrects usage of db.api.network_get

Sets project_only='allow_none' to get the network whose project_id
is None or not.

Fixes bug 1075215

Change-Id: I80622b1f5ccf194b4810bd0560bd0cdb077370df

commit_message:
Added options to improve offline usage.

 * NOVA_ZIPBALL_URL can be set for a XS/XCP install to point to a
   non-standard zipball location.
 * PIP_USE_MIRRORS (default True) can be set to False to stop pip
   from attempting to use mirrors (useful for when using an offline
   eggproxy).

Change-Id: I01a9944fe4c13c8cc8323a703f598bc498491b73

commit_message:
Add multiple database support to configure_tempest

After support for multiple databases were added to devstack,
configure tempest would not work with update_database() in
localrc.

This sources lib/database before localrc is loaded so that
update_database is defined. Also, COMPUTE_DB_URI is now
replaced by BASE_SQL_CONN from lib/database.

Change-Id: Ifd791e5732898a661cc1237839bd18cef2f36f60
Signed-off-by: Matthew Treinish <treinish@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

[{'created': '2012-11-08 03:24:26.000000000', 'message': "Move client connection out of resources.py.

Client connection references are currently cached at the resource instance
level, which doesn't seem very useful.

This change moves the client connection and caching to clients.py, then puts a
Clients instance in a Stack. This means that (for example) all requests to nova
in one stack will come from the same client instance.

Change-Id: I22519f8ae4278ad128d3785d090294285f3a1b89
"}]
commit_message:
Move client connection out of resources.py.

Client connection references are currently cached at the resource instance
level, which doesn't seem very useful.

This change moves the client connection and caching to clients.py, then puts a
Clients instance in a Stack. This means that (for example) all requests to nova
in one stack will come from the same client instance.

Change-Id: I22519f8ae4278ad128d3785d090294285f3a1b89

'}, {'created': '2012-11-07 03:03:15.000000000', 'message': 'Decouple EC2 API from using instance id

Continuation of 0dc32690fe158e4cb11c2c9bcc65acaf73b94a7a

Some code in ec2 api use Instance.id rather than InstanceIdMapping.id
directly while converting ec2 id to an instance object. This is very
dangerous if Instance.id is not equal to InstanceIdMapping.id for the
same instance uuid.

To avoid the id mapping confusion, this patch:

 * uses instance_id_mappings.id instead of instances.id
 * uses instance_uuid in ec2utils.id_to_ec2_inst_id
 * removes ec2utils.ec2_instance_id_to_uuid

Change-Id: I22638f667c18eefe542b03e31f1a3aa2ce782db7
'}]
commit_message:
Decouple EC2 API from using instance id

Continuation of 0dc32690fe158e4cb11c2c9bcc65acaf73b94a7a

Some code in ec2 api use Instance.id rather than InstanceIdMapping.id
directly while converting ec2 id to an instance object. This is very
dangerous if Instance.id is not equal to InstanceIdMapping.id for the
same instance uuid.

To avoid the id mapping confusion, this patch:

 * uses instance_id_mappings.id instead of instances.id
 * uses instance_uuid in ec2utils.id_to_ec2_inst_id
 * removes ec2utils.ec2_instance_id_to_uuid

subject: When using the image cache don't burn up IO.
messages:
[{'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-11-03 02:52:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-03 02:56:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed

- http://logs.openstack.org/15328/1/check/gate-nova-merge/11211 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/15328/1/check/gate-nova-docs/6952 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/15328/1/check/gate-nova-pep8/12262 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/15328/1/check/gate-nova-python26/8405 : FAILURE
- http://logs.openstack.org/15328/1/check/gate-nova-python27/8472 : FAILURE
- http://logs.openstack.org/15328/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/16808 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/15328/1/check/gate-nova-pylint/2380 : FAILURE (non-voting)
"}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-11-03 07:09:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-11-03 12:13:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'm not sure about this.

Since it's in a separate task it shouldn't block the rest of nova.

Also system level control of contention for resources should be done at as high a level as possible, like with putting process (groups) in cgroups and or controlling with I/O priorities etc.

Doing this explicitly seems wrong.

Also prempting yourself after every 32K by default seems far too aggressive anyway

Also it introduces 2 new config variables"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-11-03 15:40:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-11-03 15:43:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

side note: according to testing that IBM did, forcing the base images to raw doesn't give any real performance benefit, so you could probably save a lot of time on the checksumming (as well as first boot time) by setting force_raw_images=False in your config."}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-11-05 18:44:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

All good to know, p-draigbrady, is it a separate task, it sure doesn't seem like it is anymore, its a separate greenlet, but a different process. Thats the pain point that I have seen, which has caused us just to turn sha1 checking off."}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-11-05 22:28:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-11-05 22:30:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-05 22:53:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed

- http://logs.openstack.org/15328/3/check/gate-nova-merge/11362 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/15328/3/check/gate-nova-docs/7101 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/15328/3/check/gate-nova-pep8/12411 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/15328/3/check/gate-nova-python26/8553 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/15328/3/check/gate-nova-python27/8621 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/15328/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/17064 : FAILURE
- http://logs.openstack.org/15328/3/check/gate-nova-pylint/2485 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
"}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-11-06 00:32:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(4 inline comments)

This is better thanks.

I was wrong previously when I said the task was run concurrently. It's done as a utils.LoopingCall()
which just does greenthread.spawn(). I'm still
getting used to this cooperative multitasking :)

Suggested tweaks inline..."}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-11-06 00:34:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-11-06 00:55:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2012-11-07 21:32:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'm a bit confused by this patch. The commit message says we're doing too much IO, but the patch doesn't appear to reduce the amount of IO we actually do.

I'm not sure how I feel about using an external command to generate hashes. Sure, it might be faster, but its more complicated to deploy and deployment is already hard.

Given Iddb092468fae1e7af18134bc433708410d15184d might land soon, would we be better off adding a small utility to run checksums outside of nova-compute instead of trying to get this to not block other more important tasks inside nova-compute?"}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-11-07 22:00:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I agree, a small utility would seem like the better way, one that can run as much or as little as people want. I'm fine with discarding this, was just a possible way to go, not the only way."}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2012-11-07 22:04:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Well, I think yielding between image is a good idea (probably not between chunks though), which I think first came up in this review. Either this review should go back to just doing that, or I'll create a new review for it -- up to you.

Given the checksum frequency is now configurable and tested by the checksumming code before doing anything (well, once Iddb092468fae1e7af18134bc433708410d15184d lands), so long as the small tool is running more frequently then the flag in nova-compute defines, this code would always be run out of process.

The tool doesn't even need to be shipped by nova, although I think it would be better if it is so that its kept in sync with this code.

I can whip up that tool today if you want."}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-11-07 22:06:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Wfm, since u the caching expert that seems applicable.'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-11-08 01:11:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

Michael has got it under control!'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-03 02:35:05.000000000', 'message': "When using the image cache don't burn up IO.

Currently when a image is cached and hash verification
is enabled the process doing the hashing will likely
absorb most of the IO on the given machine. Since image
cache management is a background process it does not seem
useful to do this or at least possible to make it sleep
between chunk reading. Configuring the chunk size used for
chunk reading also will likely decrease the time spent
hashing. This is especially relevant for large raw files.

Change-Id: I0d53e19a36ec7e82f36ef4d06b4517606b5573f7
"}, {'created': '2012-11-05 22:28:41.000000000', 'message': "When using the image cache don't burn up IO.

Currently when a image is cached and hash verification
is enabled the process doing the hashing will likely
absorb most of the IO on the given machine. Since image
cache management is a background process it does not seem
useful to do this or at least possible to make it use a external
and faster program for hashing (sha1sum) and falling back
to using the native python code. This is especially relevant for
large raw files where the effect of this hashing is pretty large.

Change-Id: I0d53e19a36ec7e82f36ef4d06b4517606b5573f7
"}, {'created': '2012-11-05 22:30:44.000000000', 'message': "When using the image cache don't burn up IO.

Currently when a image is cached and hash verification
is enabled the process doing the hashing will likely
absorb most of the IO on the given machine. Since image
cache management is a background process it does not seem
useful to do this or at least possible to make it use a external
and faster program for hashing (sha1sum) and falling back
to using the native python code. This is especially relevant for
large raw files where the effect of this hashing is pretty large.

Change-Id: I0d53e19a36ec7e82f36ef4d06b4517606b5573f7
"}]
commit_message:
When using the image cache don't burn up IO.

Currently when a image is cached and hash verification
is enabled the process doing the hashing will likely
absorb most of the IO on the given machine. Since image
cache management is a background process it does not seem
useful to do this or at least possible to make it use a external
and faster program for hashing (sha1sum) and falling back
to using the native python code. This is especially relevant for
large raw files where the effect of this hashing is pretty large.

Change-Id: I0d53e19a36ec7e82f36ef4d06b4517606b5573f7

commit_message:
Use openstack common timeutils in simple db api

This patch switches out all direct use of datetime in the simple db api,
fixing bug 1075843.

Change-Id: Icbbaa9215588fc9bbe2b83fa156025acef6d9457

commit_message:
Relational links

Added API conventions for collection (e.g. next/previous) and
member relational links (e.g. self).

- Simplified example ID's to 6 characters
- Reduced unnecessary use of bulleted lists to improve rendering

Change-Id: I96fd0033130cb2cee1851069bfab5a9ec6fbfc49

commit_message:
Refactor resource tracker claims and test logic.

In preparation for adding resize support to resource tracker:

* Claim class has been factored out of resource tracker.
* Broke out claim testing logic for easier re-use

This patch is pre-work to ease adding resize claims to
resource tracker:

bug 1065267

Change-Id: Ib0b856376417f140dc9ed114913f47a8a790b8a2

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-01 23:01:05.000000000', 'message': 'Allows deletion of multiple servers through CLI

Adds nargs to argparse for delete command to allow
multiple (optional) positional server argument. This
allows users to delete multiple servers using nova delete.
For example:
nova delete xxx yyy aaa zzz will delete valid servers
xxx, yyy and zzz and print exception msg for invalid
delete of server aaa.

Fixes bug892061

Change-Id: I2abe6329e489bfbd3e5ae699e97ef098b38c4537
'}]
commit_message:
Allows deletion of multiple servers through CLI

Adds nargs to argparse for delete command to allow
multiple (optional) positional server argument. This
allows users to delete multiple servers using nova delete.
For example:
nova delete xxx yyy aaa zzz will delete valid servers
xxx, yyy and zzz and print exception msg for invalid
delete of server aaa.

Fixes bug892061

Change-Id: I2abe6329e489bfbd3e5ae699e97ef098b38c4537

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-07 21:18:54.000000000', 'message': "Fix cloud-init runcmd to be exec friendly

Can't use colon builtin apparently, or you'll get this:
/var/lib/cloud/instance/scripts/runcmd: line 2:
 {setenforce 0 > /dev/null 2>&1 ||:: No such file or directory

Added cloud-init debug output to get the above, copied from:
http://bazaar.launchpad.net/~cloud-init-dev/cloud-init/trunk/view/head:/doc/examples/cloud-config-chef.txt

Change-Id: I341cf73bc9a0f843d7ab8c99a9d15e1d514654e7
Signed-off-by: Jeff Peeler <jpeeler@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix cloud-init runcmd to be exec friendly

Can't use colon builtin apparently, or you'll get this:
/var/lib/cloud/instance/scripts/runcmd: line 2:
 {setenforce 0 > /dev/null 2>&1 ||:: No such file or directory

Added cloud-init debug output to get the above, copied from:
http://bazaar.launchpad.net/~cloud-init-dev/cloud-init/trunk/view/head:/doc/examples/cloud-config-chef.txt

Change-Id: I341cf73bc9a0f843d7ab8c99a9d15e1d514654e7
Signed-off-by: Jeff Peeler <jpeeler@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Delete from store after registry delete.

Because we rely on the registry to determine authorization in the glance
v1 api, we must attempt a registry delete before deleting an image from
the image store.

This patch includes the test for the bug, which was posted separately
on the bug.

Fixes bug 1065187.

Change-Id: I1a06b7c7421524066c684539e2f3516c4ed2c475

The FakeAuthMiddleware was defaulting to admin=True for request
contexts. This creates a situation where it is impossible to test
non-admin requests in some situations.

Change-Id: I949f708efed9f07a43b8506870c5b38fce4b3752
'}]
commit_message:
FakeAuth not always admin

The FakeAuthMiddleware was defaulting to admin=True for request
contexts. This creates a situation where it is impossible to test
non-admin requests in some situations.

Change-Id: I949f708efed9f07a43b8506870c5b38fce4b3752

commit_message:
Ensure that HTTP 400 codes are returned for invalid input

Fixes bug 1062046

A number of additional validation functions were added. They
do basic validations.

Change-Id: I0fc207e996f11b50fdaa4d80075ae5704cba7003

commit_message:
pin sqlalchemy to the 0.7 series

sqlalchemy 0.8 beta has hit mirrors, and changes dependencies, thus
breaking jenkins. This pins it to 0.7 series until all the projects
agree to move forward to 0.8.

Fixes bug #1073569

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-05 17:50:11.000000000', 'message': "Fix bandwidth polling exception.

When the bandwidth polling task tries to update bw usage for an
instance that does not have an entry for the last two periods already
in the bw_usage_cache table, it will throw an exception in the
polling task. This was just a misses 'if' statement.

Also:
xenserver: fix swapped bw data in xs plugin.

This fixes bug 1075255

Change-Id: I44bb143039fcdfc8dacb13b67ae8f79dc5f38777
"}]
commit_message:
Fix bandwidth polling exception.

When the bandwidth polling task tries to update bw usage for an
instance that does not have an entry for the last two periods already
in the bw_usage_cache table, it will throw an exception in the
polling task. This was just a misses 'if' statement.

Also:
xenserver: fix swapped bw data in xs plugin.

This fixes bug 1075255

Change-Id: I44bb143039fcdfc8dacb13b67ae8f79dc5f38777

So this is cool, but I had something a little different in mind;

cinder/volume/driver/__init__, rbd.py, sheepdog.py....

The only question was whether *san* would be a dir off of this, or directly under driver/ as you set it up earlier.  The object heirarchy seems to fit to have driver/san/xxxx 

I can be convinced, but my thought was that the only py files in cinder/volume/ would be manager.py, scheduler.py, api.py, utils.py, volume_types.py and the __init__ file.'}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2012-10-31 06:56:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Splitting out volume drivers in driver.py

Moved RBDDriver, SheepdogDriver into their own respective driver
files under cinder/volume/drivers/*. Moved FakeISCSIDriver and
LoggingVolumeDriver into a fake driver file under the tests,
since that's the only place where those are used.

Implements bp driver-cleanup

Change-Id: I39d91ac8e498a9e42c5443db16706203b988444b

Port openstack-common/uuidutils to Cinder

openstack-common has a new uuidutils to handle is_uuid_like(),
port it to Cinder.

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-07 15:09:58.000000000', 'message': 'Delete from store after registry delete.

Because we rely on the registry to determine authorization in the glance
v1 api, we must attempt a registry delete before deleting an image from
the image store.

This patch includes the test for the bug, which was posted separately
on the bug.

Fixes bug 1065187.

Change-Id: I1a06b7c7421524066c684539e2f3516c4ed2c475
'}]
commit_message:
Delete from store after registry delete.

Because we rely on the registry to determine authorization in the glance
v1 api, we must attempt a registry delete before deleting an image from
the image store.

This patch includes the test for the bug, which was posted separately
on the bug.

Fixes bug 1065187.

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-31 21:36:56.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Regenerates xml instead of using on-disk

The libvirt.xml file is written on initial boot of the instance and
may not reflect the current state of the vm if volumes have been
attached. If the libvirt definition of the vm has been lost, it is
safer to regenerate it rather than attempt to load it from the
outdated file. This should properly bring back vms with attached
volumes.

Fixes bug 1073720

Change-Id: Iaa754700a149f09fc0c022fa664c06ad17f505f5
'}, {'created': '2012-11-07 00:49:00.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Regenerates xml instead of using on-disk

The libvirt.xml file is written on initial boot of the instance and
may not reflect the current state of the vm if volumes have been
attached. If the libvirt definition of the vm has been lost, it is
safer to regenerate it rather than attempt to load it from the
outdated file. This should properly bring back vms with attached
volumes.

Fixes bug 1073720

Change-Id: Iaa754700a149f09fc0c022fa664c06ad17f505f5
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Regenerates xml instead of using on-disk

The libvirt.xml file is written on initial boot of the instance and
may not reflect the current state of the vm if volumes have been
attached. If the libvirt definition of the vm has been lost, it is
safer to regenerate it rather than attempt to load it from the
outdated file. This should properly bring back vms with attached
volumes.

Fixes bug 1073720

Change-Id: Iaa754700a149f09fc0c022fa664c06ad17f505f5

commit_message:
If there is no ZUUL_REF, don't fetch it.

Periodic jobs don't get a ZUUL_REF, so don't try to check it out,
just fall back to checking otu the branch.

Change-Id: Id2769d70800a03ccf49012c6f3fce14cffec9671

commit_message:
Map NotAuthorized to 403 in floating ips extension

When a NotAuthorized exception is raised in the network
manager, it would be presented as an HTTP 401 exception
through the floating ips extension. This patch presents it
as a 403 instead.

Fixes bug 1074505

Change-Id: Idb45c78755a182635ef353bb9ec8b557c8ea9b16

commit_message:
Forbid resizing instance to deleted instance types

Sets read_deleted="no" while get_instance_type_by_flavor_id to forbid
resizing instance to deleted instance types

Fixes bug 1068539

Change-Id: I3859f63a33391a840e041f06f08af361b6d64157

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-07 07:59:19.000000000', 'message': "Update KillFilter to handle 'deleted' exe's.

Updates KillFilter so that it handles the case where the executable
linked to by /proc/PID/exe is updated or deleted.

Includes new test case with coverage for this fix as well.

Fixes LP Bug #1073768

Change-Id: If568693e0b491f8806ff0156701766929ca0b3e0
"}]
commit_message:
Update KillFilter to handle 'deleted' exe's.

Updates KillFilter so that it handles the case where the executable
linked to by /proc/PID/exe is updated or deleted.

Includes new test case with coverage for this fix as well.

Fixes LP Bug #1073768

Change-Id: If568693e0b491f8806ff0156701766929ca0b3e0

[{'created': '2012-11-06 19:55:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix quota updating during soft delete and restore

Fixes bug 1075716

Quotas were not properly updated when soft deletes were enabled. This
patch fixes quotas for soft deletes and restores.

Change-Id: I77fd3ff76caa9eba3e2180c1abcfb390ea7857d6
'}]
commit_message:
Fix quota updating during soft delete and restore

Fixes bug 1075716

Quotas were not properly updated when soft deletes were enabled. This
patch fixes quotas for soft deletes and restores.

Change-Id: I77fd3ff76caa9eba3e2180c1abcfb390ea7857d6

[{'created': '2012-10-30 14:42:31.000000000', 'message': 'refactor: extract class XenAPISessionBase

Related to blueprint xenapi-volume-drivers

As xenapi access will be required in cinder, this change extracts
low-level xenapi session management (pooling) to a base class, that
could be moved to nova-common later.

Change-Id: I801fc09f1f9717580d8114c18fe788a32a584499
'}]
commit_message:
refactor: extract class XenAPISessionBase

Related to blueprint xenapi-volume-drivers

As xenapi access will be required in cinder, this change extracts
low-level xenapi session management (pooling) to a base class, that
could be moved to nova-common later.

Change-Id: I801fc09f1f9717580d8114c18fe788a32a584499

commit_message:
Add short-names for entrypoints drivers.

Since we have entrypoints namespacing now, we can use sensible
names that don't tie to class names in an extensible manner.

Part of blueprint entrypoints-plugins.

Change-Id: Ifc6f7659186a82b29e2c7c568290d0db88913260

commit_message:
Clean and add support for pyflakes testing.

Clean all of the pyflakes warnings in the tree, and then add a tox
job to enable running of pyflakes so that we can keep it that way.

Change-Id: I0135b4fbab28e3f44fffbdd8b847506bf13ff42a

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-04 21:46:59.000000000', 'message': 'Switch from FLAGS to CONF in misc modules

Use the global CONF variable instead of FLAGS. This is purely a cleanup
since FLAGS is already just another reference to CONF.

We leave the nova.flags imports until a later cleanup commit since
removing them may cause unpredictable problems due to config options not
being registered.

Change-Id: Ib110ba8d1837780e90b0d3fe13f8e6b68ed15f65
'}]
commit_message:
Switch from FLAGS to CONF in misc modules

Use the global CONF variable instead of FLAGS. This is purely a cleanup
since FLAGS is already just another reference to CONF.

We leave the nova.flags imports until a later cleanup commit since
removing them may cause unpredictable problems due to config options not
being registered.

Change-Id: Ib110ba8d1837780e90b0d3fe13f8e6b68ed15f65

Use the global CONF variable instead of FLAGS. This is purely a cleanup

commit_message:
Switch from FLAGS to CONF in nova.network

Use the global CONF variable instead of FLAGS. This is purely a cleanup
since FLAGS is already just another reference to CONF.

We leave the nova.flags imports until a later cleanup commit since
removing them may cause unpredictable problems due to config options not
being registered.

Change-Id: I20b45c6325e9a03b8800032f761c2b6101376e8e

commit_message:
Pass username and password as well as token.

This matches the behaviour of heat-cfn.
One day Heat will support doing all operations with only a token. Today is not that day.
Also add a --token-only option to suppress sending username/password.

more inline, bug generally....

I think our "snapshot_same_host" trick should be in the scheduler_rpcapi?  It was always really a "scheduling" decision even if it bypasses the scheduler manager?

Maybe I'm looking at it wrong, but importing the scheduler's rpc driver directly in the volume api, for the purpose of *bypassing* the scheduler seems kinda strange too?

commit_message:
Add 'create_volume' to scheduler RPC API.

Instead of directly call RPC methods, 'create_volume' should be
implemented in scheduler RPC API in order to do versioning.

This increases scheduler RPC version to 1.1

Change-Id: I22d5a097ec3a73c3460f4acd35c602da57f8b52d

commit_message:
Fixed instance deletion issue from Nova API.

When host Compute is down, Nova API deletes the resources associated with the
instance. However, since the instance is marked deleted first, the next query
to update the instance vm_state and task_state in DB fails. And instance
remains in state vm_state=ACTIVE, task_state=DELETING, deleted=True.

Fixes LP: #1074305

Change-Id: I0a4e64d180b4b2c5e398a21a62b29b7d59549a9f

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-06 18:12:19.000000000', 'message': "Remove dm_setup(remove) call in volume_delete.

While it makes sense to perform the dm_setup(remove) before
performing the lvm remove, it seems to cause some buffer IO
errors as evident by kern.log.

I'm also a bit suspicous in that it seems the delete timeouts
we see seems to have increased in frequency with this addition.
I propose this step is removed until we completely understand the
impact of the kernel error on Precise kernels.

Fixes bug: #1075675

Change-Id: I7ae4decea42d8f070d774d3e6376686b3e5b4f83
"}]
commit_message:
Remove dm_setup(remove) call in volume_delete.

While it makes sense to perform the dm_setup(remove) before
performing the lvm remove, it seems to cause some buffer IO
errors as evident by kern.log.

I'm also a bit suspicous in that it seems the delete timeouts
we see seems to have increased in frequency with this addition.
I propose this step is removed until we completely understand the
impact of the kernel error on Precise kernels.

Fixes bug: #1075675

Change-Id: I7ae4decea42d8f070d774d3e6376686b3e5b4f83

Change-Id: Id01724a85d9aff3b32b3502be06a84578fa8f4df
'}]
commit_message:
Read deleted flavors when using to_xml()

Fixes bug 1073736

Extend get_instance_type to accept an optional flag to return inactive
flavors and use this within to_xml().

Change-Id: Id01724a85d9aff3b32b3502be06a84578fa8f4df

commit_message:
Fix to include error message in instance faults

port the patch in 1013350 from Bill Darbie (bill-darbie) into latest code base.

incorporate one little comment from Russell about not specifying the default value twice

added a test case

Fixes bug 1013350

Change-Id: Id61f10bf2502fa57d2d26199ba9608e4566e8624

(2 inline comments)

Couple inline comments:  I'd like to track timing for errors as well (in one lumped bucket).

Also, I believe the StatsD docs go into what gets counted in "errors" vs. "timing", and those semantics have changed (eg. 404s used to be timed and are now counted as errors... but I'd like all errors to be timed, just in a different "bucket"; see inline comment).'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2012-11-06 17:44:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Switch from FLAGS to CONF in nova.scheduler

Use the global CONF variable instead of FLAGS. This is purely a cleanup
since FLAGS is already just another reference to CONF.

We leave the nova.flags imports until a later cleanup commit since
removing them may cause unpredictable problems due to config options not
being registered.

Change-Id: Ia3f66aec300fd88e91cef926da735f9e95aa2cc2

commit_message:
Switch from FLAGS to CONF in nova.api

Use the global CONF variable instead of FLAGS. This is purely a cleanup
since FLAGS is already just another reference to CONF.

We leave the nova.flags imports until a later cleanup commit since
removing them may cause unpredictable problems due to config options not
being registered.

Change-Id: I11fda86471fbf02eec342b95ec314792388307e3

commit_message:
Type is now mandatory. Boolean now exists.

This is required for Quantum resource types to work with new Properties.

commit_message:
Make Boolean property a bool type.
Since json has a native bool type, allow bool or string as the property value.
Validating a Boolean type value will now convert a string to a bool.

Change-Id: Ia1843e0f56e5afb2914708e42b62f2063279317f

commit_message:
nova-manage network commands only when n-net enabled

This patch checks if n-net is enabled rather than any nova service
before creating networks through nova.  Fixes bug 1073313

Change-Id: I8810737ddbb26a5e281060f5395cfad5d186b6d3

commit_message:
Removes the vestigial tests.

This gets rid of the misleading tests in this repo which have not been
relied on for most of this project's life (for historical reasons, tests
are currently stored in the reddwarf_lite-integration repo).

Change-Id: Ic452396ac50ea252bbd34d41638c2f337da3ed2a

[{'created': '2012-11-06 15:15:40.000000000', 'message': "make utils.mkfs() more general

While types other than 'vfat' don't seem to be used at present,
it seems better to allow labels on all file system types,
for future maintenance, and to at least alleviate confusion.

Change-Id: I80110eff577e56e9e48354813efbc3e5488d6257
"}]
commit_message:
make utils.mkfs() more general

While types other than 'vfat' don't seem to be used at present,
it seems better to allow labels on all file system types,
for future maintenance, and to at least alleviate confusion.

Change-Id: I80110eff577e56e9e48354813efbc3e5488d6257

commit_message:
details the reboot behavior that a virt driver should follow.

fixes bug 1000774

Change-Id: I5df52f296c86bf00a52f121d440d7ae16a5ee3c9
